verses.verse: וַיְהִ֥י <WH1961> way·hî came ( Ezekiel the Watchman for Israel) דְבַר־ <WH1697> ḏə·ḇar- Again the word יְהוָ֖ה <WH3068> Yah·weh of the LORD אֵלַ֥י <WH413> ’ê·lay to me, לֵאמֹֽר׃ <WH559> lê·mōr saying,

בֶּן־ <WH1121> ben- “ Son אָדָ֗ם <WH120> ’ā·ḏām of man, דַּבֵּ֤ר <WH1696> dab·bêr speak אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- to בְּנֵֽי־ <WH1121> bə·nê- your people עַמְּךָ֙ <WH5971> ‘am·mə·ḵā ... וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ <WH559> wə·’ā·mar·tā and tell אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם <WH413> ’ă·lê·hem them: אֶ֕רֶץ <WH776> ’e·reṣ a land, כִּֽי־ <WH3588> kî- ‘ Suppose אָבִ֥יא <WH935> ’ā·ḇî I bring עָלֶ֖יהָ <WH5921> ‘ā·le·hā against חָ֑רֶב <WH2719> ḥā·reḇ the sword וְלָקְח֨וּ <WH3947> wə·lā·qə·ḥū choose עַם־ <WH5971> ‘am- and the people הָאָ֜רֶץ <WH776> hā·’ā·reṣ of that land אִ֤ישׁ <WH376> ’îš man אֶחָד֙ <WH259> ’e·ḥāḏ a מִקְצֵיהֶ֔ם <WH7097> miq·ṣê·hem from among them, וְנָתְנ֥וּ <WH5414> wə·nā·ṯə·nū appointing אֹת֛וֹ <WH853> ’ō·ṯōw him לָהֶ֖ם Prep│3mp ( lā·hem) as their לְצֹפֶֽה׃ 6822 Prep-l│V-Qal-Prtcpl-ms ( lə·ṣō·p̄eh) watchman,

וְרָאָ֥ה <WH7200> wə·rā·’āh and he sees אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - הַחֶ֖רֶב <WH2719> ha·ḥe·reḇ the sword בָּאָ֣ה <WH935> bā·’āh coming עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- against הָאָ֑רֶץ <WH776> hā·’ā·reṣ that land וְתָקַ֥ע <WH8628> wə·ṯā·qa‘ and blows בַּשּׁוֹפָ֖ר <WH7782> baš·šō·w·p̄ār the ram’s horn וְהִזְהִ֥יר <WH2094> wə·hiz·hîr to warn אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - הָעָֽם׃ <WH5971> hā·‘ām the people.

וְשָׁמַ֨ע <WH8085> wə·šā·ma‘ Then if anyone hears הַשֹּׁמֵ֜עַ <WH8085> haš·šō·mê·a‘ ... אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - ק֤וֹל <WH6963> qō·wl the sound הַשּׁוֹפָר֙ <WH7782> haš·šō·w·p̄ār of the horn וְלֹ֣א <WH3808> wə·lō but fails נִזְהָ֔ר <WH2094> niz·hār to heed the warning, וַתָּ֥בוֹא <WH935> wat·tā·ḇō·w comes חֶ֖רֶב <WH2719> ḥe·reḇ and the sword וַתִּקָּחֵ֑הוּ <WH3947> wat·tiq·qā·ḥê·hū and takes him away, דָּמ֥וֹ <WH1818> dā·mōw his blood בְרֹאשׁ֖וֹ <WH7218> ḇə·rō·šōw on his own head. יִֽהְיֶֽה׃ <WH1961> yih·yeh will be

אֵת֩ <WH853> ’êṯ - ק֨וֹל <WH6963> qō·wl the sound הַשּׁוֹפָ֤ר <WH7782> haš·šō·w·p̄ār of the horn שָׁמַע֙ <WH8085> šā·ma‘ Since he heard וְלֹ֣א <WH3808> wə·lō but failed נִזְהָ֔ר <WH2094> niz·hār to heed the warning, דָּמ֖וֹ <WH1818> dā·mōw his blood בּ֣וֹ Prep│3ms ( bōw) on his own head. יִֽהְיֶ֑ה 1961 V-Qal-Imperf-3ms ( yih·yeh) will be וְה֥וּא 1931 Conj-w│Pro-3ms ( wə·hū) If he נִזְהָ֖ר 2094 V-Nifal-Perf-3ms ( niz·hār) had heeded the warning, נַפְשׁ֥וֹ 5315 N-fsc│3ms ( nap̄·šōw) his life. מִלֵּֽט׃ 4422 V-Piel-Perf-3ms ( mil·lêṭ) he would have saved

וְ֠הַצֹּפֶה <WH6822> wə·haṣ·ṣō·p̄eh the watchman כִּֽי־ <WH3588> kî- But if יִרְאֶ֨ה <WH7200> yir·’eh sees אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - הַחֶ֜רֶב <WH2719> ha·ḥe·reḇ the sword בָּאָ֗ה <WH935> bā·’āh coming וְלֹֽא־ <WH3808> wə·lō- and fails תָקַ֤ע <WH8628> ṯā·qa‘ to blow בַּשּׁוֹפָר֙ <WH7782> baš·šō·w·p̄ār the horn וְהָעָ֣ם <WH5971> wə·hā·‘ām the people, לֹֽא־ <WH3808> lō- - נִזְהָ֔ר <WH2094> niz·hār to warn וַתָּב֣וֹא <WH935> wat·tā·ḇō·w comes חֶ֔רֶב <WH2719> ḥe·reḇ and the sword וַתִּקַּ֥ח <WH3947> wat·tiq·qaḥ and takes away מֵהֶ֖ם Prep-m│Pro-3mp ( mê·hem) ... נָ֑פֶשׁ 5315 N-fs ( nā·p̄eš) a life, ה֚וּא 1931 Pro-3ms ( hū) then that one בַּעֲוֺנ֣וֹ 5771 Prep-b│N-csc│3ms ( ba·‘ă·wō·nōw) in his iniquity, נִלְקָ֔ח 3947 V-Nifal-Perf-3ms ( nil·qāḥ) will be taken away וְדָמ֖וֹ 1818 Conj-w│N-msc│3ms ( wə·ḏā·mōw) for his blood מִיַּֽד־ 3027 Prep-m│N-fsc ( mî·yaḏ-) .... ’ הַצֹּפֶ֥ה 6822 Art│V-Qal-Prtcpl-ms ( haṣ·ṣō·p̄eh) but I will hold the watchman אֶדְרֹֽשׁ׃ס 1875 V-Qal-Imperf-1cs ( ’eḏ·rōš) accountable

וְאַתָּ֣ה <WH859> wə·’at·tāh As for you, בֶן־ <WH1121> ḇen- O son אָדָ֔ם <WH120> ’ā·ḏām of man, צֹפֶ֥ה <WH6822> ṣō·p̄eh you a watchman נְתַתִּ֖יךָ <WH5414> nə·ṯat·tî·ḵā I have made לְבֵ֣ית <WH1004> lə·ḇêṯ for the house יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל <WH3478> yiś·rā·’êl of Israel; וְשָׁמַעְתָּ֤ <WH8085> wə·šā·ma‘·tā so hear מִפִּי֙ <WH6310> mip·pî My mouth דָּבָ֔ר <WH1697> dā·ḇār the word וְהִזְהַרְתָּ֥ <WH2094> wə·hiz·har·tā and give them the warning from Me אֹתָ֖ם <WH853> ’ō·ṯām . מִמֶּֽנִּי׃ <WH4480> mim·men·nî from

בְּאָמְרִ֣י <WH559> bə·’ā·mə·rî If I say לָרָשָׁ֗ע <WH7563> lā·rā·šā‘ to the wicked, רָשָׁע֙ <WH7563> rā·šā‘ ‘ O wicked [man], מ֣וֹת <WH4191> mō·wṯ you will surely die תָּמ֔וּת <WH4191> tā·mūṯ ..., ’ וְלֹ֣א <WH3808> wə·lō but you do not דִבַּ֔רְתָּ <WH1696> ḏib·bar·tā speak out לְהַזְהִ֥יר <WH2094> lə·haz·hîr to dissuade רָשָׁ֖ע <WH7563> rā·šā‘ him מִדַּרְכּ֑וֹ <WH1870> mid·dar·kōw from his way, ה֤וּא <WH1931> hū then that רָשָׁע֙ <WH7563> rā·šā‘ wicked [man] בַּעֲוֺנ֣וֹ <WH5771> ba·‘ă·wō·nōw in his iniquity, יָמ֔וּת <WH4191> yā·mūṯ will die וְדָמ֖וֹ <WH1818> wə·ḏā·mōw his blood. מִיָּדְךָ֥ <WH3027> mî·yā·ḏə·ḵā yet I will hold you accountable for אֲבַקֵּֽשׁ׃ <WH1245> ’ă·ḇaq·qêš ...

וְ֠אַתָּה <WH859> wə·’at·tāh you כִּֽי־ <WH3588> kî- But if הִזְהַ֨רְתָּ <WH2094> hiz·har·tā warn רָשָׁ֤ע <WH7563> rā·šā‘ the wicked [man] מִדַּרְכּוֹ֙ <WH1870> mid·dar·kōw from his way, לָשׁ֣וּב <WH7725> lā·šūḇ to turn מִמֶּ֔נָּה <WH4480> mim·men·nāh וְלֹא־ <WH3808> wə·lō- and he does not שָׁ֖ב <WH7725> šāḇ turn מִדַּרְכּ֑וֹ <WH1870> mid·dar·kōw from it, ה֚וּא <WH1931> hū he בַּעֲוֺנ֣וֹ <WH5771> ba·‘ă·wō·nōw in his iniquity, יָמ֔וּת <WH4191> yā·mūṯ will die וְאַתָּ֖ה <WH859> wə·’at·tāh but you נַפְשְׁךָ֥ <WH5315> nap̄·šə·ḵā your life. ( See ) הִצַּֽלְתָּ׃ס <WH5337> hiṣ·ṣal·tā will have saved

( The Message of the Watchman) וְאַתָּ֣ה <WH859> wə·’at·tāh Now as for you, בֶן־ <WH1121> ḇen- son אָדָ֗ם <WH120> ’ā·ḏām of man, אֱמֹר֙ <WH559> ’ĕ·mōr tell אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- - בֵּ֣ית <WH1004> bêṯ the house יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל <WH3478> yiś·rā·’êl of Israel כֵּ֤ן <WH3651> kên that this is what אֲמַרְתֶּם֙ <WH559> ’ă·mar·tem [they] have said לֵאמֹ֔ר <WH559> lê·mōr ... כִּֽי־ <WH3588> kî- ...: פְשָׁעֵ֥ינוּ <WH6588> p̄ə·šā·‘ê·nū ‘ Our transgressions וְחַטֹּאתֵ֖ינוּ <WH2403> wə·ḥaṭ·ṭō·ṯê·nū and our sins עָלֵ֑ינוּ <WH5921> ‘ā·lê·nū are heavy וּבָ֛ם Conj-w│Prep│3mp ( ū·ḇām) upon us, אֲנַ֥חְנוּ 587 Pro-1cp ( ’ă·naḥ·nū) and we נְמַקִּ֖ים 4743 V-Nifal-Prtcpl-mp ( nə·maq·qîm) are wasting away because of them! וְאֵ֥יךְ 349 Conj-w│Interjection ( wə·’êḵ) How נִֽחְיֶֽה׃ 2421 V-Qal-Imperf-1cp ( niḥ·yeh) can we live? ’

אֱמֹ֨ר <WH559> ’ĕ·mōr Say אֲלֵיהֶ֜ם <WH413> ’ă·lê·hem to them: חַי־ <WH2416> ḥay- live, אָ֣נִי׀ <WH589> ’ā·nî ‘ As surely as I נְאֻ֣ם׀ <WH5002> nə·’um declares אֲדֹנָ֣י <WH136> ’ă·ḏō·nāy the Lord יְהוִ֗ה <WH3069> Yah·weh GOD, אִם־ <WH518> ’im- I take no אֶחְפֹּץ֙ <WH2654> ’eḥ·pōṣ pleasure בְּמ֣וֹת <WH4194> bə·mō·wṯ in the death הָרָשָׁ֔ע <WH7563> hā·rā·šā‘ of the wicked, כִּ֣י <WH3588> kî but rather אִם־ <WH518> ’im- ... בְּשׁ֥וּב <WH7725> bə·šūḇ should turn רָשָׁ֛ע <WH7563> rā·šā‘ that the wicked מִדַּרְכּ֖וֹ <WH1870> mid·dar·kōw from their ways וְחָיָ֑ה <WH2421> wə·ḥā·yāh and live. שׁ֣וּבוּ <WH7725> šū·ḇū Turn! שׁ֜וּבוּ <WH7725> šū·ḇū Turn מִדַּרְכֵיכֶ֧ם <WH1870> mid·dar·ḵê·ḵem ways! הָרָעִ֛ים <WH7451> hā·rā·‘îm from your evil וְלָ֥מָּה <WH4100> wə·lām·māh For why תָמ֖וּתוּ <WH4191> ṯā·mū·ṯū should you die, בֵּ֥ית <WH1004> bêṯ O house יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃פ <WH3478> yiś·rā·’êl of Israel? ’

וְאַתָּ֣ה <WH859> wə·’at·tāh Therefore, בֶן־ <WH1121> ḇen- son אָדָ֗ם <WH120> ’ā·ḏām of man, אֱמֹ֤ר <WH559> ’ĕ·mōr say אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- to בְּנֵֽי־ <WH1121> bə·nê- your people עַמְּךָ֙ <WH5971> ‘am·mə·ḵā ...: צִדְקַ֣ת <WH6666> ṣiḏ·qaṯ ‘ The righteousness הַצַּדִּ֗יק <WH6662> haṣ·ṣad·dîq of the righteous man לֹ֤א <WH3808> lō will not תַצִּילֶ֙נּוּ֙ <WH5337> ṯaṣ·ṣî·len·nū deliver him בְּי֣וֹם <WH3117> bə·yō·wm in the day פִּשְׁע֔וֹ <WH6588> piš·‘ōw of his transgression; וְרִשְׁעַ֤ת <WH7564> wə·riš·‘aṯ will the wickedness הָֽרָשָׁע֙ <WH7563> hā·rā·šā‘ of the wicked man לֹֽא־ <WH3808> lō- neither יִכָּ֣שֶׁל <WH3782> yik·kā·šel cause him to stumble בָּ֔הּ Prep│3fs ( bāh) בְּי֖וֹם 3117 Prep-b│N-msc ( bə·yō·wm) on the day שׁוּב֣וֹ 7725 V-Qal-Inf│3ms ( šū·ḇōw) he turns מֵֽרִשְׁע֑וֹ 7562 Prep-m│N-msc│3ms ( mê·riš·‘ōw) from his wickedness. וְצַדִּ֗יק 6662 Conj-w│Adj-ms ( wə·ṣad·dîq) the righteous man לֹ֥א 3808 Adv-NegPrt ( lō) Nor will יוּכַ֛ל 3201 V-Qal-Imperf-3ms ( yū·ḵal) be able לִֽחְי֥וֹת 2421 Prep-l│V-Qal-Inf ( liḥ·yō·wṯ) to survive בָּ֖הּ Prep│3fs ( bāh) by his righteousness בְּי֥וֹם 3117 Prep-b│N-msc ( bə·yō·wm) on the day חֲטֹאתֽוֹ׃ 2398 V-Qal-Inf│3ms ( ḥă·ṭō·ṯōw) he sins. ’

בְּאָמְרִ֤י <WH559> bə·’ā·mə·rî If I tell לַצַּדִּיק֙ <WH6662> laṣ·ṣad·dîq the righteous man חָיֹ֣ה <WH2421> ḥā·yōh that he will surely live יִֽחְיֶ֔ה <WH2421> yiḥ·yeh ..., וְהֽוּא־ <WH1931> wə·hū- but he then בָטַ֥ח <WH982> ḇā·ṭaḥ trusts עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- in צִדְקָת֖וֹ <WH6666> ṣiḏ·qā·ṯōw his righteousness וְעָ֣שָׂה <WH6213> wə·‘ā·śāh and commits עָ֑וֶל <WH5766> ‘ā·wel iniquity, כָּל־ <WH3605> kāl- then none צִדְקָתוֹ <WH6666> ṣiḏ·qå̄·ṯō of his righteous works לֹ֣א <WH3808> lō ... תִזָּכַ֔רְנָה <WH2142> ṯiz·zā·ḵar·nāh will be remembered; וּבְעַוְל֥וֹ <WH5766> ū·ḇə·‘aw·lōw because of the iniquity אֲשֶׁר־ <WH834> ’ă·šer- - עָשָׂ֖ה <WH6213> ‘ā·śāh he has committed בּ֥וֹ Prep│3ms ( bōw) . יָמֽוּת׃ 4191 V-Qal-Imperf-3ms ( yā·mūṯ) he will die
